==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|き|k1=きっ|て|yomi=irr|sort=きって}}

===Etymology 1===
From {{m|ja|切る|sc=Jpan}} (''kiru'', "cut," "slice," "carve") + {{m|ja|手|sc=Jpan}} (''te'', "hand")

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|きって}}

# a [[stamp]]; a substitute for [[postage]] stuck to the [[postcard]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{top2}}
* {{l|ja|切手帳}} (''kittechō''): stamp album; stamp booklet
* {{l|ja|切手集め}} (''kitteatsume''): stamp collecting
* {{l|ja|切手蒐集}}, {{l|ja|切手収集}} (''kitte shūshū''): philately, stamp collecting
* {{l|ja|切手収集家}} (''kitte shūshūka''): philatelist, stamp collector
* {{l|ja|切手を溜める}} (''shūshū o tameru''): collect stamps
* {{l|ja|小切手}} (''kogitte''): check
* {{l|ja|小切手外交}} (''kogitte gaikō''): checkbook diplomacy
* {{l|ja|記念切手}} (''kinen kitte''): special issue stamp
* {{l|ja|商品切手}} (''shōhin kitte''): merchandise certificate
* {{l|ja|郵便切手}} (''yūbin kitte''): postage stamp
{{mid2}}
* {{l|ja|偽小切手}} (''gikogitte''): counterfeit check, bad paper
* {{l|ja|送金小切手}} (''sōkin kogitte''): cashier's check, demand draft
* {{l|ja|保証小切手}} (''hoshō kogitte''): certified check
* {{l|ja|旅行小切手}} (''ryokō kogitte''): traveler's check
* {{l|ja|使用済み切手}} (''shiyōzumi kitte''): used stamps
* {{l|ja|国際返信切手券}} (''kokusai henshin kitte-ken''): international reply-paid coupon
* {{l|ja|不渡り小切手}} (''fuwatari kogitte''): dishonored check
* {{l|ja|旅行者用小切手}} (''ryokōsha-yō kogitte''): traveler's check
* {{l|ja|給料支払小切手}} (''kyūryō shiharai kogitte''): paycheck
{{bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
From {{m|ja|切れる|sc=Jpan}} (''kireru'', "be able to do") + {{m|ja|手|sc=Jpan}} (''te'', "hand")

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|きれて}}

# [[man]] of [[ability]]

====Usage notes====
* In this sense, [[切れ手]] is used more commonly than [[切手]]

* ''The Oxford Starter Japanese Dictionary.'' ISBN 0-19-860197-2
